title: The Tudor Needle Test
script: Think modern pregnancy tests are stressful? In Tudor England, finding out you were pregnant involved peeing into a wooden bowl... and then dropping a metal sewing needle in it. If the needle rusted or turned red a few days later, congratulations, you were officially having a baby! It was wildly unhygienic, but surprisingly, the acidity of the urine actually made it kind of accurate.
